posts.text:
Hospital de Sant Pau. Barcelona. 1902.

Domenech i Montaner connected every pavilion with underground tunnels so patients only ever see gardens. Architecture as medicine.

app.architecturehelper.com/architecture_explorer/1049

Barcelona has some of the most distinctive architecture on Earth. Gaudi gets the headlines, but the whole city is a masterclass.

Here are some highlights 🧵
Modernisme (Catalan Art Nouveau) — Barcelona's signature
Medieval & Gothic
The contemporary stuff holds its own too

Full guide with all 15 buildings, analysis, and map for virtual or IRL tour:
app.architecturehelper.com/places/barcelona

🇵🇱 Kraków architecture guide just dropped!

Wawel Castle, St. Mary's Basilica, the Renaissance Cloth Hall, a medieval Barbican & a theatre that rivals the Paris Opéra.

Poland's architectural jewel → app.architecturehelper.com/places/krakow

🏛️ Barcelona just dropped on Architecture Helper!

15 buildings from Gaudí's Sagrada Família to the Gothic Quarter. Casa Batlló, Casa Vicens, Torre Glòries & more.

Explore the full guide → app.architecturehelper.com/places/barcelona

🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿 Edinburgh architecture guide is live!

From the Castle on its volcanic crag to the bold Scottish Parliament by Enric Miralles. 13 buildings spanning medieval, Georgian & contemporary.

Explore → app.architecturehelper.com/places/edinburgh

🇧🇪 New city guide: Bruges, Belgium

Medieval Europe's best-preserved architectural time capsule. The Belfry, Church of Our Lady (tallest brick tower in the world), Gothic town halls & more.

Explore → app.architecturehelper.com/places/bruges

Edinburgh is two cities stacked on top of each other.

Medieval Old Town: narrow, dark, buildings piled 10 stories high.
Georgian New Town: wide streets, symmetrical facades, planned to the inch.

They're separated by a valley. You can stand in one and see the other. Surreal.

app.architecturehelper.com/places/edinburgh

3 Art Nouveau buildings on the same block in Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia, the Block of Discord:

Casa Batllo (Gaudi, 1906)
Casa Amatller (Puig i Cadafalch, 1900) 
Casa Lleo Morera (Domenech i Montaner, 1905)

Three architects competing. Nobody lost.

app.architecturehelper.com/places/barcelona

The Belfry of Bruges. 83 meters of brick. Started in 1240.

It leans slightly to the east. 800 years of settling.

The 47-bell carillon still plays. You can hear it across the city on quiet mornings.

app.architecturehelper.com/places/bruges

St. Marys Basilica, Krakow. Every hour a trumpet call plays from the taller tower. It stops mid-melody.

Legend says the original trumpeter was shot through the throat by a Mongol archer in 1241. Theyve been cutting the melody short ever since.

app.architecturehelper.com/places/krakow

Unpopular opinion: the most interesting buildings in any city aren't the famous ones.

They're the weird ones. The ones where you stop and think 'what was the architect going through?'

Drop a building that made you do a double take.

What's a building you walked past for years before you actually looked up and noticed it?

For me it's always the ones hiding incredible details above the first floor. Most people never look up.

Just added Blooma to the directory. AI-powered deal underwriting for commercial real estate.

Analyzes rent rolls, does cash flow projections, generates investment memos. Starting at $500/mo.

cresoftware.tech/product.html#blooma

Property management software is the most crowded category in CRE tech right now.

We track 30+ tools. Some charge $1/unit/month. Others want $50K/year.

If you're shopping, start here: cresoftware.tech/category.html#property-management

Noticed something interesting looking at CRE software pricing:

The tools that show pricing publicly tend to be cheaper. The ones that say 'contact sales' tend to be 3-5x more.

Transparency is a feature.

Looking for CRE software? We just hit 208 products across 14 categories.

Property management, deal management, construction, investor reporting & more. Real features, real pricing, real comparisons.

cresoftware.tech
